title: Ancient art of spring couplets thrives in modern Taiwan
description: Explore the enduring tradition of spring couplets in Chinese culture, highlighting their role in fostering festive cheer and warding off evil spirits during the Lunar New Year. Learn about their origins, types, and symbolic meanings, including the integration of zodiac imagery and artistic innovations.

title: ‘I want to connect people to their history’ – Meet the Belfast man mapping out Ireland’s ancient past
description: Daniel Kirkpatrick is a history blogger and data analyst who maps Ireland’s ancient historical sites

title: Ancient woodland filled with waterfalls, grottos and hidden ruins
description: The 120-acre National Trust site near Masham features 18th-century grottos, waterfalls and ruins hidden within ancient woodland on the edge of the Yorkshire Dales

title: Ancient stone fort with 'breathtaking' views across three counties
description: The fort sits atop an 800-foot hill in Donegal and is steeped in mystical legends dating back to the 6th and 7th century

title: Ancient 'supernatural' stone fort with stunning views across five counties
description: The site is an ancient ring fort perched on a hilltop in County Donegal, offering panoramic views and steeped in Irish legends dating back centuries
